AssociateDDoSEipAddress.document: This API is used to bind an EIP to an Anti-DDoS Advanced instance or a specified private IP of an ENI.
AssociateDDoSEipAddress.name: Binds EIPs

AssociateDDoSEipLoadBalancer.document: This API is used to bind an Anti-DDoS EIP to the specified private IP of a CLB instance.
AssociateDDoSEipLoadBalancer.name: Binds an Anti-DDoS EIP to a CLB instance

CreateBlackWhiteIpList.document: This API is used to add an Anti-DDoS IP blocklist/allowlist.
CreateBlackWhiteIpList.name: Adds an Anti-DDoS IP blocklist/allowlist

CreateBoundIP.document: This API is used to bind an IP to an Anti-DDoS Pro instance Both single IP instances and multi-IP instances are available. Note that you should wait until the current binding or unbinding completes before using this async API for new operations.
CreateBoundIP.name: Binds an IP to an Anti-DDoS Pro instance

CreateDDoSAI.document: This API is used to set Anti-DDoS AI protection switches.
CreateDDoSAI.name: Sets Anti-DDoS AI protection switches

CreateDDoSGeoIPBlockConfig.document: This API is used to add an Anti-DDoS region blocking configuration.
CreateDDoSGeoIPBlockConfig.name: Adds Anti-DDoS region blocking configurations

CreateDDoSSpeedLimitConfig.document: This API is used to add Anti-DDoS access rate limit configurations.
CreateDDoSSpeedLimitConfig.name: Adds Anti-DDoS access rate limit configurations

CreateDefaultAlarmThreshold.document: This API is used to set the default alarm threshold of an IP.
CreateDefaultAlarmThreshold.name: Sets the default alarm threshold of an IP

CreateIPAlarmThresholdConfig.document: This API is used to set the default alarm threshold of an IP.
CreateIPAlarmThresholdConfig.name: Sets the alarm threshold of an IP

CreateL7RuleCerts.document: This API is used to configure certificates with layer-7 forwarding rules in a batch for SSL testing.
CreateL7RuleCerts.name: Configures certificates with layer-7 forwarding rules in a batch

CreatePacketFilterConfig.document: This API is used to add Anti-DDoS feature filtering rules.
CreatePacketFilterConfig.name: Adds Anti-DDoS feature filtering rules

CreateProtocolBlockConfig.document: This API is used to set Anti-DDoS protocol blocking configurations.
CreateProtocolBlockConfig.name: Sets Anti-DDoS protocol blocking configurations

CreateSchedulingDomain.document: This API is used to create a domain name for IP scheduling and switching.
CreateSchedulingDomain.name: Creates a domain name for IP scheduling and switching

CreateWaterPrintConfig.document: This API is used to add Anti-DDoS watermark configurations.
CreateWaterPrintConfig.name: Adds Anti-DDoS watermark configurations

CreateWaterPrintKey.document: This API is used to add Anti-DDoS watermark keys.
CreateWaterPrintKey.name: Adds Anti-DDoS watermark keys

DeleteBlackWhiteIpList.document: This API is used to delete an Anti-DDoS IP blocklist/allowlist.
DeleteBlackWhiteIpList.name: Deletes an Anti-DDoS IP blocklist/allowlist

DeleteDDoSGeoIPBlockConfig.document: This API is used to delete Anti-DDoS region blocking configurations.
DeleteDDoSGeoIPBlockConfig.name: Deletes Anti-DDoS region blocking configurations

DeleteDDoSSpeedLimitConfig.document: This API is used to delete Anti-DDoS access rate limit configurations.
DeleteDDoSSpeedLimitConfig.name: Deletes Anti-DDoS access rate limit configurations

DeletePacketFilterConfig.document: This API is used to delete Anti-DDoS feature filtering rules.
DeletePacketFilterConfig.name: Deletes Anti-DDoS feature filtering rules

DeleteWaterPrintConfig.document: This API is used to delete Anti-DDoS watermark configurations.
DeleteWaterPrintConfig.name: Deletes Anti-DDoS watermark configurations

DeleteWaterPrintKey.document: This API is used to delete Anti-DDoS watermark keys.
DeleteWaterPrintKey.name: Deletes Anti-DDoS watermark keys

DescribeBasicDeviceStatus.document: This API is used to querying the status of Anti-DDoS IP.
DescribeBasicDeviceStatus.name: Gets the Anti-DDoS protection status

DescribeBizTrend.document: This API is used to get the traffic flow data collected in the specified period.
DescribeBizTrend.name: Gets the traffic flow data collected in the specified period

DescribeBlackWhiteIpList.document: This API is used to get an Anti-DDoS IP blocklist/allowlist.
DescribeBlackWhiteIpList.name: Gets an Anti-DDoS IP blocklist/allowlist

DescribeCCTrend.document: This API is used to get CC attack data, including total QPS peaks, attack QPS, total number of requests and number of attack requests.
DescribeCCTrend.name: Gets CC attack data

DescribeDDoSTrend.document: This API is used to get DDoS attack traffic bandwidth and attack packet rate.
DescribeDDoSTrend.name: Gets DDoS attack data

DescribeDefaultAlarmThreshold.document: This API is used to get the default alarm threshold of an IP.
DescribeDefaultAlarmThreshold.name: Gets the default alarm threshold of an IP

DescribeL7RulesBySSLCertId.document: This API is used to query layer-7 rules matched with certificate IDs.
DescribeL7RulesBySSLCertId.name: Queries layer-7 rules matched with certificate IDs

DescribeListBGPIPInstances.document: This API is used to get a list of Anti-DDoS Advanced instances.
DescribeListBGPIPInstances.name: Gets a list of Anti-DDoS Advanced instances

DescribeListBGPInstances.document: This API is used to get a list of Anti-DDoS Pro instances.
DescribeListBGPInstances.name: Gets a list of Anti-DDoS Pro instances

DescribeListBlackWhiteIpList.document: This API is used to get a list of Anti-DDoS IP blocklists/allowlists.
DescribeListBlackWhiteIpList.name: Gets a list of Anti-DDoS IP blocklists/allowlists

DescribeListDDoSAI.document: This API is used to get a list of Anti-DDoS AI protection switches.
DescribeListDDoSAI.name: Gets a list of Anti-DDoS AI protection switches

DescribeListDDoSGeoIPBlockConfig.document: This API is used to get a list of Anti-DDoS region blocking configurations.
DescribeListDDoSGeoIPBlockConfig.name: Gets a list of Anti-DDoS region blocking configurations

DescribeListDDoSSpeedLimitConfig.document: This API is used to get a list of Anti-DDoS access rate limit configurations.
DescribeListDDoSSpeedLimitConfig.name: Gets a list of Anti-DDoS access rate limit configurations

DescribeListIPAlarmConfig.document: This API is used to get a list of IP alarm threshold configurations.
DescribeListIPAlarmConfig.name: Gets a list of IP alarm threshold configurations

DescribeListListener.document: This API is used to get a list of forwarding listeners.
DescribeListListener.name: Gets a list of forwarding listeners

DescribeListPacketFilterConfig.document: This API is used to get a list of Anti-DDoS feature filtering rules.
DescribeListPacketFilterConfig.name: Gets a list of Anti-DDoS feature filtering rules

DescribeListProtectThresholdConfig.document: This API is used to get a list of protection threshold configurations for AI protection switch, protection level, and CC threshold switch.
DescribeListProtectThresholdConfig.name: Gets a list of protection threshold configurations

DescribeListProtocolBlockConfig.document: This API is used to get a list of Anti-DDoS protocol blocking configurations.
DescribeListProtocolBlockConfig.name: Gets a list of Anti-DDoS protocol blocking configurations

DescribeListSchedulingDomain.document: This API is used to get a list of intelligent scheduling domain names.
DescribeListSchedulingDomain.name: Gets a list of intelligent scheduling domain names

DescribeListWaterPrintConfig.document: This API is used to get a list of Anti-DDoS watermark configurations.
DescribeListWaterPrintConfig.name: Gets a list of Anti-DDoS watermark configurations

DisassociateDDoSEipAddress.document: This API is used to unbind an Anti-DDoS EIP.
DisassociateDDoSEipAddress.name: Unbinds an Anti-DDoS EIP

ModifyDDoSGeoIPBlockConfig.document: This API is used to modify Anti-DDoS region blocking configurations.
ModifyDDoSGeoIPBlockConfig.name: Modifies Anti-DDoS region blocking configurations

ModifyDDoSSpeedLimitConfig.document: This API is used to modify Anti-DDoS access rate limit configurations.
ModifyDDoSSpeedLimitConfig.name: Modifies Anti-DDoS access rate limit configurations

ModifyDomainUsrName.document: This API is used to modify intelligent scheduling domain names.
ModifyDomainUsrName.name: Modifies intelligent scheduling domain names

ModifyNewDomainRules.document: This API is used to modify layer-7 forwarding rules.
ModifyNewDomainRules.name: Modifies layer-7 forwarding rules

ModifyPacketFilterConfig.document: This API is used to modify Anti-DDoS feature filtering rules.
ModifyPacketFilterConfig.name: Modifies Anti-DDoS feature filtering rules

SwitchWaterPrintConfig.document: This API is used to enable or disable Anti-DDoS watermark configurations.
SwitchWaterPrintConfig.name: Enables/Disables Anti-DDoS watermark configurations

members.document: Anti-DDoS instance ID (only Anti-DDoS Advanced). For example, `bgpip-0000011x`.
members.name: InstanceId

members.name: Eip

members.document: Instance ID to bind. For example, `ins-11112222`. It can be queried in the console or obtained from `InstanceId` returned by `DescribeInstances`.
members.name: CvmInstanceID

members.document: Region of the CVM instance. For example, `ap-hongkong`.
members.name: CvmRegion

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Anti-DDoS instance ID (only Anti-DDoS Advanced). For example, `bgpip-0000011x`.
members.name: InstanceId

members.document: EIP of the Anti-DDoS instance ID.
members.name: Eip

members.document: ID of the CLB to bind, such as `lb-0000002i`. It can be queried in the console or obtained from `LoadBalancerId` returned by the `DescribeLoadBalancers` API.
members.name: LoadBalancerID

members.document: Region of the CLB instance, such as `ap-hongkong`.
members.name: LoadBalancerRegion

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Anti-DDoS instance details
members.name: InstanceDetail

members.document: Anti-DDoS instance specifications
members.name: SpecificationLimit

members.document: Anti-DDoS instance usage statistics
members.name: Usage

members.document: Region of the Anti-DDoS instance
members.name: Region

members.document:
Status of the Anti-DDoS instance. Valid values:
`idle`: running
`attacking`: under attacks
`blocking`: blocked
`creating`: creating
`deblocking`: unblocking
`isolate`: reprocessed and isolated
members.name: Status

members.document: Purchase time
members.name: ExpiredTime

members.document: Expired At
members.name: CreatedTime

members.document: Name of the Anti-DDoS instance
members.name: Name

members.document:
Package details of the Anti-DDoS instance.
Note: This field is `null` for an Anti-DDoS instance without using a package.
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value can be obtained.
members.name: PackInfo

members.document:
Non-BGP package details of the Anti-DDoS instance.
Note: This field is `null` for an Anti-DDoS instance without using a non-BGP package.
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value can be obtained.
members.name: StaticPackRelation

members.document:
Specifies the ISP. `0`: Chinese mainland ISPs (default); `1`：Radware；`2`: Tencent; `3`: NSFOCUS. Note that `1`, `2` and `3` are used for services outside the Chinese mainland.
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: ZoneId

members.document:
Used to differentiate clusters
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value can be obtained.
members.name: Tgw

members.document:
EIP states: `CREATING`, `BINDING`, `BIND`, `UNBINDING`, `UNBIND`, `OFFLINING`, and `BIND_ENI`. The EIP must be bound to an Anti-DDoS Advanced instance.
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value can be obtained.
members.name: EipAddressStatus

members.document:
Whether it is an Anti-DDoS EIP instance. `1`: Yes; `0`: No.
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value can be obtained.
members.name: EipFlag

members.document:
EIP package details of the Anti-DDoS Advanced instance.
Note: This field is `null` for an Anti-DDoS Advanced instance without using an EIP package.
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value can be obtained.
members.name: EipAddressPackRelation

members.document:
Details of the Anti-DDoS Advanced instance bound to the EIP.
Note: This field is `null` if the EIP is not bound to an Anti-DDoS Advanced instance.
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value can be obtained.
members.name: EipAddressInfo

members.document:
Recommended domain name for clients to access.
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Domain

members.document: Whether to enable Sec-MCA. Valid values: `1` (enabled) and `0` (disabled).
members.name: DamDDoSStatus

members.document:
Whether it’s an IPv6 address. `1`: Yes; `0`: No.
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: V6Flag

members.document: Category of product that can be bound. Valid values: `public` (CVM and CLB), `bm` (BM), `eni` (ENI), `vpngw` (VPN gateway), `natgw` (NAT gateway), `waf` (WAF), `fpc` (financial products), `gaap` (GAAP), and `other` (hosted IP).
members.name: BizType

members.document: Anti-DDoS instance ID of the IP. This field is required if the instance ID is bound to a new IP. For example, this field InstanceId will be `eni-*` if the instance ID is bound to an ENI IP; `none` if there is no instance ID to bind to a hosted IP.
members.name: InstanceId

members.document: Sub-product category. Valid values: `cvm` (CVM), `lb` (Load balancer), `eni` (ENI), `vpngw` (VPN gateway), `natgw` (NAT gateway), `waf` (WAF), `fpc` (financial products), `gaap` (GAAP), `eip` (BM EIP) and `other` (hosted IP).
members.name: DeviceType

members.document: ISP. Valid values: `0` (China Telecom), `1` (China Unicom), `2` (China Mobile),`5` (BGP).
members.name: IspCode

members.document: Array of IPs to bind to the Anti-DDoS instance. For Anti-DDoS Pro Single IP instance, the array contains only one IP. If there are no IPs to bind, it is empty; however, either `BoundDevList` or `UnBoundDevList` must not be empty.
members.name: BoundDevList

members.document: Array of IPs to unbind from the Anti-DDoS instance. For Anti-DDoS Pro Single IP instance, the array contains only one IP; if there are no IPs to unbind, it is empty; however, either `BoundDevList` or `UnBoundDevList` must not be empty.

Rate limit mode. Valid values:
`1`: rate limit based on the real server IP
`2`: rate limit based on the destination port
]
members.name: Mode

members.document: Rate limit value. This field contains at least one valid rate limit type. Note that only up to one value of each type is supported.
members.name: SpeedValues

members.document: This field is replaced with a new field DstPortList.
members.name: DstPortScopes

members.document:
IP protocol number. Valid values:
`ALL`: all protocols
`TCP`: TCP protocol
`UDP`: UDP protocol
`SMP`: SMP protocol
`1;2–100`: user-defined protocol with up to 8 ranges
]
Note: For custom protocol ranges, only protocol number is supported. Multiple ranges are separated by ";". If the value is `ALL`, any other protocol or protocol number should be excluded.
members.name: ProtocolList

members.document: Port range list, which contains up to 8 ranges. Use ";" to separate multiple ports and "–" to indicate a range of ports, as described in the following formats: `0–65535`, `80;443;1000–2000`.
members.name: DstPortList

members.document:
Status of the specified Anti-DDoS resource. Valid values:
`1`: The IP is blocked.
`2`: The P is normal.
`3`: The IP is being attacked.
members.name: Data

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Statistical method. Valid values: `max`, `min`, `avg`, `sum`. It can only be `max` if the statistical dimension is traffic rate or packet rate.
members.name: Statistics

members.document: Anti-DDoS service type (`bgpip`: Anti-DDoS Advanced)
members.name: Business

members.document: Sampling interval. Valid values: `300`, `1800`, `3600`, `21600`, `86400`
members.name: Period

members.document: Beginning of the time range for the query, such as `2020-09-22 00:00:00`.
members.name: StartTime

members.document: End of the time range for the query, such as `2020-09-22 00:00:00`.
members.name: EndTime

members.document: Instance ID
members.name: Id

members.document: Metric. Valid values: `connum`, `new_conn`, `inactive_conn`, `intraffic`, `outtraffic`, `inpkg`, `outpkg`, `qps`
members.name: MetricName

EipProductInfo.document: Details of the cloud product used by the EIP

members.document: IP address
members.name: Ip

members.document:
Cloud product category. Valid values:
`public`: CVM
`bm`: BM
`eni`: ENI
`vpngw`: VPN gateway
 `natgw`: NAT gateway
`waf`: WAF
`fpc`: financial products
`gaap`: GAAP 
`other`: hosted IP
]
members.name: BizType

members.document: Cloud sub-product category. Valid values: `cvm` (CVM), `lb` (Load balancer), `eni` (ENI), `vpngw` (VPN gateway), `natgw` (NAT gateway), `waf` (WAF), `fpc` (financial products), `gaap` (GAAP), `eip` (BM EIP) and `other` (hosted IP).
members.name: DeviceType

members.document: Cloud instance ID of the IP. This field InstanceId will be `eni-*` if the instance ID is bound to an ENI IP; `none` if there is no instance ID to bind to a hosted IP.

members.name: FrontendPort

members.document:
Forwarding protocol. Valid values:
`TCP`
`UDP`
]

Alarm threshold type. Valid values:
`1`: alarm threshold for inbound traffic
`2`: alarm threshold for cleansing attack traffic
]

members.document: Protocol. Valid values: `tcp`, `udp`, `icmp`, `all`.
members.name: Protocol

members.document: Start source port. Value range: 0–65535.
members.name: SportStart

members.document: End source port. Value range: 0–65535. The value also should be greater than or equal to that of the start source port.
members.name: SportEnd

members.document: Start destination port
members.name: DportStart

members.document: End destination port. Value range: 1–65535. The value also should be greater than or equal to that of the start source port.
members.name: DportEnd

members.document: Minimum message length. Value range: 1–1500.
members.name: PktlenMin

members.document: Maximum message length. Value range: 1–1500. The value also should be greater than or equal to that of the minimum message length.
members.name: PktlenMax

members.document:
Action. Valid values:
`drop`: discards the request.
`transmit`: allows the request.
`drop_black`: discards the request and adds the IP to blocklist.
`drop_rst`: blocks the request.
`drop_black_rst`: blocks the request and adds the IP to blocklist.
`forward`: continues protection.
]
members.name: Action

members.document:
Detection location:
`begin_l3`: IP header
`begin_l4`: TCP/UDP header
`begin_l5`: T load
`no_match`: no match
]
members.name: MatchBegin

members.document:
Detection type:
`sunday`: keyword
`pcre`: regular expression
]
members.name: MatchType

members.document:
Detection value. Should be in key string or regular expression. 
When the `MatchType` is `sunday`, enter a string or a string in hexadecimal byte code representation. For example, a string "123" corresponds to the hexadecimal byte code "\x313233".
When the `MatchType` is `pcre`, enter a regular expression.
]
members.name: Str

members.document: Detection depth starting from the detection position. Value range: [0, 1500].
members.name: Depth

members.document: Offset starting from the detection position. Value range: [0, Depth].
members.name: Offset

members.document:
Whether the detection value is included:
`0`: included
`1`: excluded
]
members.name: IsNot

members.document:
Relationship between the first and second detection conditions:
`and`: under both the first and second detection conditions
`none`: under only the first detection condition
]
members.name: MatchLogic

members.document:
The second detection position:
`begin_l5`: load
`no_match`: no match
]
members.name: MatchBegin2

members.document:
The second detection type:
`sunday`: keyword
`pcre`: regular expression
]
members.name: MatchType2

members.document:
The second detection value. Should be in key string or regular expression.
When the `MatchType` is `sunday`, enter a string or a string in hexadecimal byte code representation. For example, a string "123" corresponds to the hexadecimal byte code "\x313233".
When the `MatchType` is `pcre`, enter a regular expression.
]
members.name: Str2

members.document: Detection depth starting from the second detection position. Value range: [0, 1500].
members.name: Depth2

members.document: Offset starting from the second detection position. Value range: [0, Depth2].
members.name: Offset2

members.document:
Whether the second detection value is included:
`0`: included
`1`: excluded
]
members.name: IsNot2

DDoS protection level:
`low`: loose protection
`middle`: medium protection
`high`: strict protection
]

DDoS AI protection switch:

CC cleansing switch
`0`: disabled
